section.title: description
section.p: The referer plugin simply logs to a user defined file all of the HTTP referer headers it comes across. This is often useful if you want to see what google searches lead to your site. It will also group referers by flavor with overall flavor totals and filtered by date. This plugin will also filter referer's based on the contents of the blojsom wide blacklist filter.

section.title: installation and setup
section.p: In your global plugin.properties file, add the following line:
You may then add "referer-log" to one of the flavor-based plugin chains. These plugin chains can be found in the individual user's plugin.properties file. For example:
The referer plugin has its own configuration file, referer.properties, that is referenced in web.xml.
The referer.properties file will be located in the respective /WEB-INF/(user-id) directory and contains three configurable parameters:
section.source:
# # blojsom referer plugin configuration file # referer-display-size=40 referer-filename=/change/me/please/blojsom-referer.log
# NOTE:hit-count flavors just captures totals and not referer urls hit-count-flavors=rss
section.p:
referer-display-size controls the display size of the referer URL
referer-filename is the location and filename of the log file it should write to on shutdown of your application server
hit-count-flavors is a comma-separated list of the flavors that the plugin should track for referers. Flavors added to this list will only have their hit counts tracked, but will not have the referer URL tracked

section.title: filtering
section.p: This plugin will use the contents of the blacklist filter to ignore referer's that match any of the filters. this helps ignore those spam referers. This is automatic and no configuration, other that editing the blacklist.filters file.
